comments.body: The `CartesianGridProps` type doesn't list `stroke` or `strokeDasharray`. How should TypeScript know we can provide them here?
I copied the example from the starting page of recharts, and made it work with the extension from CSSStyleDeclaration of the component which can be styled.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +19,23 @@            <XAxis dataKey="name"/>
            <YAxis/>
            <CartesianGrid stroke="#eee" strokeDasharray="5 5"/>
            <Line type="monotone" dataKey="uv" stroke="#8884d8" />
            <Line type="monotone" dataKey="pv" stroke="#82ca9d" />

comments.body: The `LineProps` type doesn't list `stroke`. How should TypeScript know we can provide them here?
stroke, strokeDasharray etc. are part of the interface CSSStyleDeclaration from which CartesianGrid is extended now.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +20,24 @@            <YAxis/>
            <CartesianGrid stroke="#eee" strokeDasharray="5 5"/>
            <Line type="monotone" dataKey="uv" stroke="#8884d8" />
            <Line type="monotone" dataKey="pv" stroke="#82ca9d" />
        </LineChart>

comments.body: The `LineProps` type doesn't list `stroke`. How should TypeScript know we can provide them here?
stroke, strokeDasharray etc. are part of the interface CSSStyleDeclaration from which LineProps are extended now.
